title: Man charged after police seize cannabis worth more than £100,000 in West Lothian raid
content:
A man has been charged after police seized cannabis worth more than £100,000 in a raid in West Lothian. 
 
Officers searched a commercial property at Mill Road industrial estate in Linlithgow and recovered almost 13kg of the drug yesterday. 
 
The recovered cannabis has a potential street value of £123,000. 
  
Loading article content 
   
A 29-year-old man who was arrested and charged under the Misuse of Drugs Act has appeared at Livingston Sheriff Court. 
   
 Share article  
   
Detective Sergeant Kirsty McArthur said: "This is a significant seizure of cannabis, which will now be destroyed before it could be distributed within our communities."
